instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b works with battery but not with charger
threads.message:
hey guys ,  

                     another crazy one to share for advise . 


 problem =<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  is moving  between 2.5 volts to 4 volts .  i have checked thoroughly for liquid damage but could  not find anything may be under smc but no traces of liquid outside any where .  i do get green light some times .

i have tried another dc in board
dc voltage is about 16.15 volts 
 checked the follwing aswell

1. <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and 7022 reaing 20.1 ohms                    
2. <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> reading 2.9 ohms
 3. <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> replaced 
and also have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 


the system works on battery only .
kindly advise.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b works with battery but not with charger
threads.message: Measure resistance on the pins of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> between 17/18 and 27/28. Also check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b works with battery but not with charger
threads.message:
thanks for the reply
/ resistance between 17/18 is 3.0 ohms and 27/28 is 20.6 BUT <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> was 166 ohms so removed and replaced with another resistor and now green light is coming every time i plug in the charger but the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is fluctuating quicker between 3.96 volts and 4.15 volts .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b works with battery but not with charger
threads.message: If it does power from battery could be a bad soldering job....... Check under microscope <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b works with battery but not with charger
threads.message: Check voltage in <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> and check <RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR>. Could be bad soldering on 6259 too.
